016package de.cuioss.test.jsf.renderer;
017
018import de.cuioss.test.jsf.junit5.EnableJsfEnvironment;
019import de.cuioss.test.jsf.junit5.JsfEnabledTestEnvironment;
020import de.cuioss.test.jsf.renderer.util.DomUtils;
021import de.cuioss.test.jsf.renderer.util.HtmlTreeAsserts;
022import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.objects.ConfigurationCallBackHandler;
023import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.objects.impl.DefaultInstantiator;
024import de.cuioss.tools.reflect.MoreReflection;
025import de.cuioss.tools.string.MoreStrings;
026import jakarta.faces.component.UIComponent;
027import jakarta.faces.context.FacesContext;
028import jakarta.faces.render.FacesRenderer;
029import jakarta.faces.render.Renderer;
030import lombok.Getter;
031import org.apache.myfaces.test.mock.MockResponseWriter;
032import org.jdom2.Document;
033import org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach;
034import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
035
036import java.io.IOException;
037import java.io.StringWriter;
038
039import static de.cuioss.tools.string.MoreStrings.emptyToNull;
040import static java.util.Objects.requireNonNull;
041import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.*;
042
043/**
044 * Base class for testing implementations of {@link Renderer}. It focuses on
045 * conveniences and the basic-api contracts.
046 * <h3>Configuration</h3>
047 * <p>
048 * Documentation on the setup of the JSF-related test-infrastructure can be
049 * found at {@link EnableJsfEnvironment}
050 * </p>
051 * <p>
052 * It acts as an {@link ConfigurationCallBackHandler}, saying after
053 * initialization and prior to testing the method {@link #configure(Object)}
054 * will be called allowing the concrete test-class to do some specific
055 * configuration e.g. calling init-methods and such.
056 * </p>
057 * <p>
058 * You can easily access pre-configured instance by calling
059 * {@link #getRenderer()}.
060 * </p>
061 * <h3>API-Tests</h3> Base {@linkplain Renderer} Test. Verify API contract of
062 * Renderer for
063 * <ul>
064 * <li>{@linkplain Renderer#decode(FacesContext, UIComponent)}</li>
065 * <li>{@linkplain Renderer#encodeBegin(FacesContext, UIComponent)}</li>
066 * <li>{@linkplain Renderer#encodeChildren(FacesContext, UIComponent)}</li>
067 * <li>{@linkplain Renderer#encodeEnd(FacesContext, UIComponent)}</li>
068 * <li>{@linkplain Renderer#convertClientId(FacesContext, String)}</li>
069 * </ul>
070 * <h3>Contracts</h3>
071 * <ul>
072 * <li>{@link #assertRenderResult(UIComponent, Document)} and
073 * {@link #assertRenderResult(UIComponent, String)} are the main 'business'
074 * methods for explicit testing</li>
075 * </ul>
076 *
077 * @param <R> The renderer being tested
078 * @author Oliver Wolff
079 */
080public abstract class AbstractRendererTestBase<R extends Renderer> extends JsfEnabledTestEnvironment
081    implements ConfigurationCallBackHandler<R> {
082
083    private static final String NPE_ON_MISSING_CLIENT_ID_EXPECTED = "NullPointerException expected on missing ClientId parameter. Use inheritance or implement own check.";
084
085    private static final String NPE_ON_MISSING_PARAMETER_EXPECTED = "NullPointerException expected on missing UIComponent parameter. Use inheritance or implement own check.";
086
087    private static final String NPE_ON_MISSING_FACESCONTEXT_EXPECTED = "NullPointerException expected on missing FacesContext. Use inheritance or implement own check.";
088
089    @Getter
090    private R renderer;
091
092    /**
093     * Instantiates and initially configures a concrete {@link Renderer}
094     */
095    @BeforeEach
096    void initRenderer() {
097        final Class<R> klazz = MoreReflection.extractFirstGenericTypeArgument(getClass());
098        renderer = new DefaultInstantiator<>(klazz).newInstance();
099        configure(renderer);
100        if (klazz.isAnnotationPresent(FacesRenderer.class)) {
101            getComponentConfigDecorator().registerRenderer(klazz);
102        }
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * @return the configured {@link UIComponent}. <em>Caution: </em> you must
107     * always create a new instance of the component on each call
108     */
109    protected abstract UIComponent getComponent();
110
111    /**
112     * Renders the given component / renderer into a String representation
113     *
114     * @param toBeRendered the component to be passed to the renderer, must not be
115     *                     null
116     * @return the String-result of the rendering
117     * @throws IOException
118     */
119    public String renderToString(final UIComponent toBeRendered) throws IOException {
120        requireNonNull(toBeRendered);
121        var output = new StringWriter();
122        getFacesContext().setResponseWriter(new MockResponseWriter(output));
123        final Renderer testRenderer = getRenderer();
124        testRenderer.encodeBegin(getFacesContext(), toBeRendered);
125        testRenderer.encodeChildren(getFacesContext(), toBeRendered);
126        testRenderer.encodeEnd(getFacesContext(), toBeRendered);
127        return output.toString();
128    }
129
130    /**
131     * Calls the renderer and checks the result against the given expected
132     * {@link Document}
133     *
134     * @param toBeRendered the component to be passed to the renderer, must not be
135     *                     null
136     * @param expected     must not be null
137     */
138    public void assertRenderResult(final UIComponent toBeRendered, final Document expected) {
139        var rendered = assertDoesNotThrow(() -> renderToString(toBeRendered));
140        assertNotNull(emptyToNull(rendered), "Render result must not be empty.");
141        HtmlTreeAsserts.assertHtmlTreeEquals(expected, DomUtils.htmlStringToDocument(rendered));
142    }
143
144    /**
145     * Shorthand for {@link #assertRenderResult(UIComponent, Document)} and
146     * {@link DomUtils#htmlStringToDocument(String)}
147     *
148     * @param toBeRendered the component to be passed to the renderer, must not be
149     *                     null
150     * @param expected     must not be null
151     */
152    public void assertRenderResult(final UIComponent toBeRendered, final String expected) {
153        assertNotNull(emptyToNull(expected), "Render result must not be empty.");
154        assertRenderResult(toBeRendered, DomUtils.htmlStringToDocument(expected));
155    }
156
157    /**
158     * Assert, that the given component does not render any output.
159     *
160     * @param toBeRendered the component to be passed to the renderer, must not be
161     *                     null
162     */
163    public void assertEmptyRenderResult(final UIComponent toBeRendered) {
164        var rendered = assertDoesNotThrow(() -> renderToString(toBeRendered));
165        assertNull(MoreStrings.emptyToNull(rendered), "Render result must be empty, but is:\n" + rendered);
166    }
167
168    // API tests
169    @Test
170    void shouldThrowNPEOnMissingParameterForDecode() {
171        assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> renderer.decode(null, getComponent()),
172            NPE_ON_MISSING_FACESCONTEXT_EXPECTED);
173        assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> renderer.decode(getFacesContext(), null),
174            NPE_ON_MISSING_PARAMETER_EXPECTED);
175    }
176
177    @Test
178    void shouldThrowNPEOnMissingParameterForEncodeBegin() {
179        assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> renderer.encodeBegin(null, getComponent()),
180            NPE_ON_MISSING_FACESCONTEXT_EXPECTED);
181        assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> renderer.encodeBegin(getFacesContext(), null));
182    }
183
184    @Test
185    void shouldThrowNPEOnMissingParameterForEncodeChildren() {
186        assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> renderer.encodeChildren(null, getComponent()),
187            NPE_ON_MISSING_FACESCONTEXT_EXPECTED);
188        assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> renderer.encodeChildren(getFacesContext(), null),
189            NPE_ON_MISSING_PARAMETER_EXPECTED);
190    }
191
192    @Test
193    void shouldThrowNPEOnMissingParameterForConvertClientId() {
194        assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> renderer.convertClientId(null, "SomeId"),
195            NPE_ON_MISSING_FACESCONTEXT_EXPECTED);
196        assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> renderer.convertClientId(getFacesContext(), null),
197            NPE_ON_MISSING_CLIENT_ID_EXPECTED);
198    }
199
200    @Test
201    void shouldThrowNPEOnMissingParameterForEncodeEnd() {
202        assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> renderer.encodeEnd(null, getComponent()),
203            NPE_ON_MISSING_FACESCONTEXT_EXPECTED);
204        assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> renderer.encodeEnd(getFacesContext(), null),
205            NPE_ON_MISSING_PARAMETER_EXPECTED);
206    }
207}
